reporting-org.narrative: Organisation des Nations unies pour l'éducation, la science et la culture (UNESCO)
United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)

title.narrative: The role of artists for human rights and dignity, Youth (MOST) School for the Rapprochement of Cultures

description.narrative: Seventy years after the signature of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights on 10 December 1948 at the Palais de Chaillot in Paris, France, UNESCO wishes to highlight the healing, reconciling and creative power of Art as a catalyst for action across religions and cultures. The Youth (MOST) School on the role of artists for human rights and dignity will bring together in a 3-day intense breakthrough young artists, researchers (sociologists, art historians, media-specialists), civil-society activists and policy actors with the objective to prove the transformative role of artists in the rapprochement of cultures and its key-enablers. Exceptional artists identified by Chaillot, could deliver inspirational master-classes, performances and exhibitions to enrich the workshops and debates.

organisation.narrative: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)
